sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: Unique-values column dropdown: a right-aligned 'üìä' button is now added to every column header cell by makeTableSortableUnified. Clicking it (or pressing Enter/Space while it has focus) opens a fixed-position scrollable panel (#mb-col-uniq-dropdown) listing all distinct non-empty values present in the column's currently visible tbody rows, sorted case-insensitively. Selecting a value (mouse click or keyboard Enter) writes it into the column's mb-col-filter-input and fires an immediate filter pass via a synthetic input event. The panel is a DOM singleton created lazily on first use.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Unique-values dropdown ‚Äî mouse-wheel scroll no longer closes the panel: the global scroll close-listener now checks ev.target and skips closing when the scroll originates inside the dropdown element itself.

Unique-values dropdown ‚Äî ArrowDown/ArrowUp now scroll through the full list: moveFocus() now directly manipulates drop.scrollTop to keep the focused item visible within the panel's own overflow container instead of calling el.scrollIntoView(), which was scrolling the page rather than the panel and caused navigation to stall at the last initially-visible item.

Unique-values dropdown ‚Äî re-render safety: 'üìä' is stripped from colName (in headers.forEach) and from getCleanColName() so repeated calls to makeTableSortableUnified do not accumulate the emoji in column labels.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Fix ghost sidebar toggle handle: The sidebar toggle handle is now positioned dynamically via JS (updateHandlePosition) instead of relying on a hard-coded CSS 'right: 240px'. The root cause was that toggleAutoResizeColumns changes the sidebar from its default right-floated layout to 'position: sticky; left: 0', making the sidebar appear at the LEFT viewport edge during horizontal scrolling ‚Äî so the fixed handle at 'right: 240px' ended up floating over the content area rather than being adjacent to the sidebar. updateHandlePosition() reads the sidebar's live getBoundingClientRect() on every scroll, resize, and toggle event and sets handle.style.right = (window.innerWidth - sidebar.left) px, keeping the handle flush against the sidebar's actual rendered left boundary at all times regardless of scroll position or CSS position changes. The CSS 'transition: right 0.3s ease' and the '.handle-collapsed { right: 0 !important }' rule have been removed to avoid CSS/JS fights on high-frequency scroll events.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: Global filter: the 'sa_filter_focus_prefix' (default 'üîç ') is now permanently visible in the global filter field at all times ‚Äî focused or not, empty or not. The field is initialized with the prefix on creation and every programmatic reset (fresh fetch, disk load, clear-all, ‚úï button) restores it to prefix-only rather than to an empty string. This is different from column filter inputs, where the prefix appears only while the field has focus. All values read from the global filter field pass through stripFilterPrefix() before use, so the invariant is transparent to all filtering logic.

sections.label: ‚ôªÔ∏è Refactoring
items: The focus and blur event listeners on the global filter input have been removed. The blur listener's secondary responsibility (calling runFilter() after stripping the prefix) is no longer needed because the prefix is never stripped on blur. The keydown guard (guardFilterPrefixKeydown) and the prefix-safety-net inside the input listener remain.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: Setting 'sa_col_filter_focus_prefix' renamed to 'sa_filter_focus_prefix'. The decorative search-icon prefix now applies to the global filter field as well as column filter fields. Both types of filter input show the prefix while focused and strip it before using the value as a filter query.

Global filter: the field now gains the same focus-mode behaviour as column filters ‚Äî the configured prefix (default 'üîç ') is prepended to the placeholder (or to the value if a filter string is already present) on focus, and stripped on blur. The keydown guard prevents Backspace/Delete/ArrowLeft/Home/Ctrl+A from reaching the prefix characters. Border colour continues to signal active state (no persistent background tint on blur, unlike column filters).
Escape key on the global filter now behaves like on column filters: first press retains the prefix and clears only the user-entered text; second press blurs the field.

Ctrl+G (focus global filter shortcut) now positions the cursor at the end of the editable content after the prefix, instead of calling select() which would have included the prefix characters in the selection.
The '‚úï' clear button for the global filter now resets the placeholder to the focus-state variant (prefix + base text) when the field remains focused after clearing.

sections.label: ‚ôªÔ∏è Refactoring
items: The four column-filter-specific helpers (stripColFilterPrefix, applyColFilterFocusStyle, removeColFilterFocusStyle, guardColFilterPrefixKeydown) have been replaced by four generalized equivalents: getFilterFocusPrefix(), stripFilterPrefix(value), applyFilterFocusStyle(input, blurPlaceholder, focusBg?), removeFilterFocusStyle(input, idlePlaceholder, hasActiveBg?), and guardFilterPrefixKeydown(input, e). The old names are retained as deprecated const aliases so no existing call site breaks. All internal call sites have been updated to the new names.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Load from Disk ‚Äî RegExp pre-filter now correctly applied: when the 'Regular Expression' checkbox in the Load dialog was checked, no rows were loaded at all. Root cause: confirmLoad() tried to sync the regex flag to the live filter bar by writing to 'preFilterRegexLabel.querySelector("input")' ‚Äî but 'preFilterRegexLabel' was never declared anywhere in the script, so the typeof guard suppressed the write and 'preFilterRxCheckbox.checked' stayed false. The fileInput.onchange handler therefore always read isRegExp=false, fell into the plain-text path, and treated the pattern literally (e.g. '^Thunder' as the string '^thunder'), which matched nothing. Fixed: the dead reference to 'preFilterRegexLabel' is replaced with a direct 'preFilterRxCheckbox.checked = useRegex' assignment.

Ctrl+Shift+Esc shortcut for 'Clear ALL filters' removed: this key combination is intercepted at the OS level on most platforms (Windows opens Task Manager; some Linux desktop environments also handle it), so it never reliably reached the browser. The keydown handler block has been removed entirely. The 'Clear ALL filters' action remains available via the configurable 'sa_shortcut_clear_filters' shortcut (default: Ctrl+Shift+G) and by clicking the '‚úï Clear ALL filters' button. The button tooltip now dynamically displays the currently configured shortcut key.

sections.label: üìù Documentation
items: ShowAllEntityData_HELP.txt: removed all references to Ctrl+Shift+Esc from the FILTERING and KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS sections. The 'Clear all filters' entry in KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS now notes that the shortcut is configurable and that the button tooltip reflects the currently configured key.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Multi-table mode: the global '[x] Rx' checkbox now exclusively controls the global filter string. Previously its state was also forwarded to getColFilters() for every sub-table, which caused column-level filters to behave as regular expressions even when no sub-table Rx checkbox was checked. Fixed: in the groupedRows loop inside runFilter() the code now looks up the sub-table's own Rx checkbox (the input ending in '-rx-checkbox' inside .mb-subtable-filter-container of the preceding h3) and passes its state ‚Äî not the global isRegExp flag ‚Äî to getColFilters().

Multi-table mode: the sub-table '[x] Rx' checkbox now correctly governs BOTH the sub-table filter string AND the column-level filters of that sub-table. Previously column filters always received the global isRegExp flag regardless of the sub-table checkbox; now they receive the sub-table checkbox state.

Single-table mode: when '[x] Rx' is set and a column-level filter field contains an invalid regular expression, the error message is now correctly displayed in the '#mb-filter-status-display' span. Previously the error string was captured in a 'const' variable declared inside the else-branch of runFilter(), making it inaccessible in the status-update block that follows outside that branch (a block-scoping bug). Fixed: the variable is now declared as 'let _singleColRxErrors = []' before the if/else, and assigned (not re-declared) inside the else-branch, so the status-update block can always read it.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Multi-table pages: column-level regexp filters now match rows correctly. Previously the raw pattern was unconditionally lowercased before being stored in the colFilters array. In regexp mode the pattern must remain as-is ‚Äî the 'i' flag in the matching step handles case-insensitivity, and lowercasing destroys character-class semantics (e.g. [A-Z] became [a-z]). Fixed: val is now set to raw when isRegExp is true.

Multi-table pages: the column regexp-error message written by getColFilters to a sub-table's span.mb-filter-status was being immediately overwritten by the post-filter status-update loop with a '‚úì Filtered N rows' message. Fixed: the update loop now skips any status span that carries the colRxError marker set by getColFilters.

Single-table pages: column regexp-error messages were silently discarded because getTableFilterStatusSpan() returns null when there is no h3 before the table, so the if(statusSpan) guard suppressed the write. Additionally, the normal '‚úì N rows' update would have overwritten any message anyway. Fixed: getColFilters now also populates result._rxErrors (an array of formatted error strings). In single-table mode the call site captures this array and, in the status-update block, shows the first error in filterStatusDisplay instead of the success message.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: Sub-table filter border colors are now configurable: 'sa_subtable_filter_border_idle' (idle/empty, default #cccccc) and 'sa_subtable_filter_border_active' (active, default #008000). The ‚úï and ‚ãÆ edge strips update in sync via the new setSubTableFilterBorder() helper.

The error border-color setting for invalid regexp is now shared across all filter types, renamed from 'sa_global_filter_border_error' to 'sa_filter_border_error'. Applies to global, sub-table, and column-level filters.
Error border width increased from 2 px to 4 px in error state, ensuring the error color is clearly visible.
Sub-table filter regexp errors now write '‚ö† Invalid regexp: ‚Ä¶' to the span.mb-filter-status of the relevant sub-table, cleared when the pattern becomes valid.

Column-level filter regexp errors (when Rx is active) now write '‚ö† Column "‚Ä¶": invalid regexp: ‚Ä¶' to the span.mb-filter-status of the associated sub-table and apply the 4 px error border to the specific column input. Invalid patterns are skipped from the filter pass. New helper getTableFilterStatusSpan() centralises the h3-to-status-span lookup.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: stfInput border reset in 'Clear all column filters' now uses settings-driven stfBorderIdle()/stfBorderActive() instead of hardcoded rgb(204,204,204).

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: Global filter border color now transitions through three configurable states: idle (empty field, default black), active (has valid filter text, default orange), and error (invalid regexp, default dark red). The border of the adjacent ‚úï and ‚ãÆ edge strips updates in sync. Three new color-picker settings ‚Äî 'Global filter border ‚Äî idle', 'Global filter border ‚Äî active', 'Global filter border ‚Äî error' ‚Äî replace the single previous 'Global filter border color' setting.

When the Rx checkbox is active and the typed pattern is not a valid regular expression, an error message ('‚ö† Invalid regexp: ‚Ä¶') is shown immediately in the filter-status display in the error color, and the filter pass is skipped until the pattern becomes valid. The error message clears automatically once the regexp parses successfully.
Global filter box-shadow glow now uses the configured active border color instead of a hardcoded red.

Column filter placeholder is now visible on a freshly focused, empty field: the placeholder embeds the search-icon prefix (sa_col_filter_focus_prefix) followed by 'Filter on this column‚Ä¶', so the hint is readable as soon as focus arrives. The prefix is only moved into the field value when the user begins typing, preserving all prefix-guard behaviour for non-empty fields. On blur the placeholder reverts to '‚Ä¶'.

Global and sub-table filter fields are now resizable: a narrow ‚ãÆ drag handle appears to the right of the ‚úï clear button. Dragging it horizontally adjusts the input width (minimum 60 px). The ‚úï button and ‚ãÆ handle are distinct rectangular strips that share the input border color, eliminating any overlap between the clear action and the resize gesture.
Global filter placeholder reads 'üîç Global Filter‚Ä¶ works across all sub-tables' on multi-table pages and 'üîç Global Filter‚Ä¶' on single-table pages.
Sub-table filter placeholder reads 'Filter "<name>"‚Ä¶ just in this sub-table'.
New number settings 'Global filter initial width' (default 500 px) and 'Sub-table filter initial width' (default 320 px) control the starting width of the respective resizable filter fields.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: Global filter border color is now configurable (single setting, default orange). Previously hardcoded to #ccc / red.
Global filter placeholder changed from 'üîç Global Filter...' to 'üîç Global Filter‚Ä¶' (ellipsis U+2026).
Sub-table filter placeholder changed from 'Filter "<name>"‚Ä¶' to 'Filter "<name>"‚Ä¶ just in this sub-table'.
Column filter default (unfocused) placeholder changed from '...' to '‚Ä¶' (ellipsis U+2026).
Column filter focused placeholder changed to 'Filter on this column‚Ä¶'.
Global and sub-table filter fields made resizable via a dedicated ‚ãÆ drag handle; initial widths configurable via sa_global_filter_initial_width and sa_subtable_filter_initial_width settings.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: RegExp pre-filter validation in the Load dialog was never reached: the invalid-pattern error was caught inside loadTableDataFromDisk(), which only runs after the dialog has already closed and the OS file-picker has opened, giving the user no way to correct the pattern. Fixed by moving validation into confirmLoad() (now async) where it fires before closeDialog() and fileInput.click(). On a bad pattern the filter input border turns red, Lib.showCustomAlert() is awaited with the engine error message, and the function returns early so the dialog stays open for correction.
confirmLoad() converted from synchronous to async to support awaiting Lib.showCustomAlert() while the dialog remains in the DOM.

loadTableDataFromDisk() regex try/catch downgraded from a user-facing Lib.showCustomAlert() call to a silent Lib.error() defensive fallback, because a valid pattern is now guaranteed by confirmLoad() for all normal UI-driven flows. Direct programmatic callers are still protected.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Per-subtable clear button (mb-subtable-clear-btn) now dynamically relabels itself: shows 'Clear all COLUMN filters' when only column filters are active (no STF), and 'Clear all filters' when the STF is active (with or without column filters). Achieved by wrapping the button text in a named span (.mb-subtable-clear-btn-label) and updating it in updateFilterButtonsVisibility(). The button title is updated in sync.

In-panel 'Clear all COLUMN filters' button (clearAllStfBtn / .mb-stf-clear-col-btn) inside each STF filter panel: visibility management moved from updateInputStyle() to updateFilterButtonsVisibility(). It now appears only when BOTH the STF input AND at least one column filter are active. Consequence: (a) when only the STF filter is active the button no longer appears, leaving the per-subtable mb-subtable-clear-btn as the sole control; (b) after the user clicks it to clear column filters, runFilter() ‚Üí updateFilterButtonsVisibility() is called and the button disappears immediately because no column filters remain. The element is given class mb-stf-clear-col-btn so updateFilterButtonsVisibility() can locate it via h3.querySelector('.').

Global 'Clear ALL filters' button (mb-clear-all-filters-btn): condition changed from (globalFilterActive || (stfFiltersActive && columnFiltersActive)) to (globalFilterActive || stfFiltersActive). The button now correctly appears whenever any global or per-subtable (STF) filter is active, not only when both STF and column filters are simultaneously active.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Global 'Clear all COLUMN filters' and 'Clear ALL filters' button visibility: tightened the rules so each button only appears when it is actually useful, avoiding duplicate/redundant controls. Previous behaviour showed both global buttons for any combination of active filters. Corrected rules (global filter aside): (1) STF filter only ‚Üí neither global clear button is shown; the per-subtable mb-subtable-clear-btn in the h3 controls bar already handles that scope. (2) Column filter(s) only, no STF or global ‚Üí only 'Clear all COLUMN filters' is shown; 'Clear ALL filters' is superfluous when there is nothing outside the column level to clear. (3) Both STF and column filters active ‚Üí both 'Clear all COLUMN filters' and 'Clear ALL filters' are shown, because a one-click 'clear everything' action is now genuinely useful. (4) Global filter active (with or without STF/column) ‚Üí 'Clear ALL filters' is always shown because it is the only button that clears the global field; 'Clear all COLUMN filters' additionally appears if any column filter is also active.

Implemented as a change to the clearAllFiltersBtn condition in updateFilterButtonsVisibility(): from (globalFilterActive || columnFiltersActive || stfFiltersActive) to (globalFilterActive || (stfFiltersActive && columnFiltersActive)). The clearColumnFiltersBtn condition (columnFiltersActive) is unchanged.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Global 'Clear ALL filters' button: was not appearing when only a sub-table (STF) filter was active. The visibility condition in updateFilterButtonsVisibility() was (globalFilterActive || columnFiltersActive) ‚Äî it included stfFiltersActive in the 'Toggle highlighting' check introduced in 9.97.17 but never added it to the 'Clear ALL filters' check. Fixed by adding stfFiltersActive to the condition so the button now appears whenever any filter at any level (global, sub-table, or column) is active.

Global 'Toggle highlighting' button ‚Äî second click (restore highlights) did nothing when only a sub-table filter was active. saveFilterHighlightState() only inspected the global filter input and column filter inputs when computing hasContent. Because neither had a value, hasContent was always false for a pure-STF-filter scenario. restoreFilterHighlightState() guards its runFilter() call behind if (!savedFilterHighlights.hasContent) return, so it exited immediately and STF highlights were never restored. Fixed by also querying all .mb-subtable-filter-container input[type="text"] elements in saveFilterHighlightState() and including any non-empty STF values in the stfFilters array and in the hasContent boolean. The existing restoreFilterHighlightState() path (calling runFilter() which calls reapplyAllSubTableFilters()) already handles re-applying STF highlights correctly once hasContent is true.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: In-panel 'Clear ALL COLUMN filters' button (introduced in 9.97.17): corrected behaviour ‚Äî the button now clears only the column-level filter inputs for that specific sub-table. The STF (sub-table filter) input is intentionally left untouched so the sub-table filter continues to be active while the column filters are wiped. Previously the button also cleared the STF input and restored STF-hidden rows, which was the wrong scope for this action.

Button title updated from 'Clear sub-table filter AND all column filters for this table' to 'Clear all COLUMN filters for this sub-table (sub-table filter is kept)' to accurately describe the corrected behaviour.
Button label updated from 'Clear ALL' to 'Clear all COLUMN filters' to clearly distinguish this in-panel button from the external 'Clear all filters' button in the sub-table controls bar.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Global 'Toggle highlighting' button: visibility is now driven by active filter *strings* rather than DOM highlight span presence. Previously the button was shown only when `.mb-global-filter-highlight` or `.mb-column-filter-highlight` spans existed in the DOM; this caused two failure modes: (1) the button never appeared when only a sub-table (STF) filter was active (those use `.mb-subtable-filter-highlight` spans which were not checked), and (2) after the user toggled highlighting OFF the spans were removed from the DOM, making the button vanish even though filters were still active ‚Äî leaving no way to re-enable highlighting without retyping the filter. The button now appears whenever any filter string is non-empty (global, any STF, or any column) and disappears as soon as all filter fields are empty.

Global 'Toggle highlighting' button: the column-filter active check now uses `stripColFilterPrefix()` consistently, so a focused-but-empty column filter field carrying only the decorative 'üîç ' prefix is no longer incorrectly counted as an active filter.

sections.label: ‚ú® Features
items: New in-panel 'Clear ALL' button added to every sub-table filter container (the collapsible panel opened by clicking the üîç toggle icon). The button is placed after the Cc/Rx/Ex option row, is initially hidden, and appears as soon as the STF input contains any text. Clicking it: (1) clears the STF input text, (2) calls clearSubFilter() to restore any rows hidden by the STF filter and remove STF highlight spans, (3) clears all column-level filter inputs for that specific table (value, background, and box-shadow), and (4) calls runFilter() so that the global/column filter view is fully refreshed. This gives users a one-click 'reset everything for this sub-table' action while keeping the STF panel open and focused.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: updateInputStyle() (inner function of createSubTableFilterContainer) now also controls the visibility of the new in-panel 'Clear ALL' button: shows it when filterInput.value is non-empty, hides it otherwise. Because updateInputStyle() is called by both applySubFilter() and clearSubFilter(), the button's visibility is always in sync with the STF input state without additional event listeners.
createSubTableFilterContainer() @returns JSDoc updated to include the newly exported clearAllStfBtn member.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Column filter ‚úï button: clicking the small clear icon now correctly re-focuses the filter field and restores the decorative focus prefix (sa_col_filter_focus_prefix), exactly matching the behaviour of pressing Escape the first time while the field has focus. Previously the browser fired blur before onclick, stripping the prefix before the handler ran, so the field always ended up empty and blurred regardless of previous state.

Sub-table filter ‚Äî 'Clear all filters' button now also appears when the sub-table (STF) filter input is active (not only when column-level filters are active). Previously the button was driven exclusively by column filter state, so typing in the STF input left the button hidden.
Sub-table filter ‚Äî 'Toggle highlighting' button now also appears as soon as the STF input receives any text, matching the behaviour that was already in place for column filters.

Sub-table filter ‚Äî clicking 'Clear all filters' (formerly 'Clear all COLUMN filters') while the STF input is active now also clears the STF field and immediately restores all rows that were hidden by it (data-mb-stf-hidden), removes STF highlight spans, and resets the input border/shadow. Previously only column inputs were cleared, leaving the STF filter visually active with no way to dismiss it via that button.

applySubFilter and clearSubFilter now call updateFilterButtonsVisibility() on completion so the per-subtable 'Clear all filters' and 'Toggle highlighting' buttons update their visibility in real time as the user types or clears the STF field ‚Äî without requiring a subsequent column-filter interaction or a full runFilter() pass.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: createSubTableHighlightButton (standalone helper introduced in 9.97.15) now also calls runFilter() in its ON branch so that column-filter highlights are also restored, not only sub-table-filter highlights.

Per-subtable 'Clear all filters' button: label shortened from 'Clear all COLUMN filters' to 'Clear all filters' and tooltip updated to 'Clear all filters for this sub-table (column filters and sub-table filter)' to reflect the extended scope.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Column filter ‚úï button: clicking the clear icon when the field is focused no longer erases the decorative focus prefix. The handler now checks whether the prefix is present before clearing, retaining it and repositioning the cursor so the interaction is identical to pressing Escape once.

Sub-table 'Clear all COLUMN filters' button visibility: the empty-check now uses stripColFilterPrefix() instead of a raw .trim() !== '' test, so a focused-but-empty column filter field (which carries the decorative 'üîç ' prefix) is no longer incorrectly counted as an active filter.

Keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Esc changed to Ctrl+Shift+Esc throughout the script and in ShowAllEntityData_HELP.txt. The previous binding was intercepted by the operating system on several platforms, making the shortcut unreachable.

sections.label: ‚ú® Features
items: Per-subtable 'Toggle highlighting' button: moved out of the collapsible STF filter panel and into the persistent .mb-subtable-controls bar (next to 'Clear all COLUMN filters') so it remains accessible even when the STF panel is closed. Button starts hidden and is shown/hidden by updateFilterButtonsVisibility() whenever any filter (STF or column) is active for that sub-table.

Per-subtable 'Toggle highlighting' button: the OFF branch now strips both .mb-subtable-filter-highlight AND .mb-column-filter-highlight spans from table rows, not only sub-table filter highlights. The ON branch calls runFilter() (in addition to applySubFilter) to restore column-filter highlights.

New helper function createSubTableHighlightButton(table, categoryName): creates a stateful 'Toggle highlighting' button for the two defensive code-paths in renderGroupedTable where .mb-subtable-controls is rebuilt from scratch (reuse-existing-table branch and missing-controls-during-filtering branch).
createSubTableFilterContainer() JSDoc return type updated to {{ toggleIcon, container, highlightBtn }} to reflect the newly exported highlightBtn.
Ctrl+Shift+Esc shortcut registered in the keyboard shortcuts reference dialog and button tooltip updated accordingly.

sections.label: ‚ú® Features
items: Column filter prefix guard: while a column filter field has focus, Backspace and Delete cannot consume the decorative focus prefix (sa_col_filter_focus_prefix). The cursor is clamped so it cannot move into the prefix region. ArrowLeft and Shift+ArrowLeft stop at the first character after the prefix. Home / Shift+Home reposition to just after the prefix rather than column 0. Ctrl+A selects only the user-editable text after the prefix.

New keyboard shortcut Shift+Esc: clears all COLUMN filters across all tables (global action ‚Äî fires regardless of which element currently has focus). Equivalent to clicking the 'Clear all COLUMN filters' button.
New keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Esc: clears ALL filters ‚Äî global filter, all sub-table filters, and all column filters (global action). Equivalent to clicking the 'Clear ALL filters' button.
Button tooltips updated: 'Clear all COLUMN filters' now shows '‚Äî global action (Shift+Esc)' and 'Clear ALL filters' shows '‚Äî global action (Ctrl+Esc)' so users discover the shortcuts via hover.
Keyboard shortcuts help dialog: Shift+Esc and Ctrl+Esc entries added to the 'Filter & Search' section.

ShowAllEntityData_HELP.txt updated: new 'COLUMN FILTER FOCUS INDICATORS' section documents the focus prefix, clamping behaviour, and the focus/active background colours. KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS section updated with Shift+Esc, Ctrl+Esc, and an expanded Escape entry. SETTINGS section notes the new colour/prefix settings.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: Added guardColFilterPrefixKeydown(input, e) helper function. Handles Backspace, Delete, ArrowLeft, Home, and Ctrl+A via a switch statement with precise selectionStart/selectionEnd arithmetic. Wired as a 'keydown' listener on every .mb-col-filter-input element created by addColumnFilterRow.

Plain-Escape handler narrowed with !e.shiftKey && !e.ctrlKey && !e.metaKey && !e.altKey guard so it never fires when Shift+Esc or Ctrl+Esc are pressed. Shift+Esc and Ctrl+Esc handlers placed before the plain-Escape block and each call stopPropagation() to prevent fall-through.

sections.label: ‚ú® Features
items: Column filter active-state indicator: when a column filter field loses focus and still contains a filter string, the background colour is now kept (switching from the focus colour to a dedicated 'active' colour, default #fff9c4) rather than cleared. This gives a persistent visual indication of which columns currently have an active filter. The background is only removed on blur when the field is empty.
New configurable setting 'Column Filter Active Background' (sa_col_filter_active_bg, default #fff9c4) added to the Settings Manager in the 'üé® FILTER HIGHLIGHT COLORS' section.

Column filter focus prefix is now configurable: the hard-coded 'üîç ' string has been moved from the module-level constant COL_FILTER_FOCUS_PREFIX into the Settings Manager as 'Column Filter Focus Prefix' (sa_col_filter_focus_prefix, default 'üîç '). It can be set to any string, including empty.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: Removed module-level constant COL_FILTER_FOCUS_PREFIX. All three helper functions (stripColFilterPrefix, applyColFilterFocusStyle, removeColFilterFocusStyle) and the Escape-key handler now read Lib.settings.sa_col_filter_focus_prefix at call time (with 'üîç ' as a ?? fallback), so prefix changes in Settings take effect immediately without a page reload.

removeColFilterFocusStyle updated: after stripping the prefix it checks whether the remaining value is empty; if so it clears backgroundColor, otherwise it applies sa_col_filter_active_bg to persist the active-filter visual.

sections.label: ‚ú® Features
items: Column filter focus indicators: when a column-level filter field receives focus (via Ctrl+C, Tab, or mouse click) a search icon prefix 'üîç ' is prepended to the field and the background turns light yellow (configurable). Both visuals are removed the moment the field loses focus ‚Äî the stored value is always the clean filter string without any decorative prefix.
New configurable setting 'Column Filter Focus Background' (sa_col_filter_focus_bg, default #fffde7) added to the 'üé® FILTER HIGHLIGHT COLORS' section of the Settings Manager.

Ctrl+C focus behaviour: the cursor is positioned right after the search-icon prefix so the user can start typing immediately. The previous .select() call that selected the entire field content (including the prefix) has been removed.

Escape key handler is now prefix-aware: a column filter field is considered empty when only the focus prefix remains (no actual filter text), so the first Escape press clears the user-entered text but restores the prefix (field stays focused), and the second Escape blurs the field (triggering the blur handler which strips the prefix). The global filter field behaviour is unchanged.

Load from Disk: any column filter inputs still in the DOM when the load is confirmed are explicitly cleared (value and background) before the DOM is rebuilt, guaranteeing no focus-mode artefacts survive into the freshly rendered table.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: Added module-level constant COL_FILTER_FOCUS_PREFIX = 'üîç ' as the single source of truth for the decorative prefix string.

Added three helper functions: stripColFilterPrefix(value) strips the prefix before a value is used as a filter string; applyColFilterFocusStyle(input) adds the prefix and bg on focus; removeColFilterFocusStyle(input) strips the prefix and clears the bg on blur.

All code paths that read .mb-col-filter-input values for filtering or status display (getColFilters, runFilter active-count, sub-table filter status, showStatsPanel, saveFilterHighlightState) now call stripColFilterPrefix() so the prefix is never treated as part of the filter expression.

All code paths that programmatically clear column filter inputs (clearAllFilters, clearColumnFiltersBtn onclick, clearSubTableColumnFilters, startFetchingProcess reset loop) now also clear input.style.backgroundColor so no yellow tint lingers after a programmatic clear.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: Replaced all fragile querySelector/querySelectorAll UI-element lookups that matched on textContent.includes(), title*=, or placeholder*= with direct document.getElementById() calls ‚Äî O(1), unambiguous, and immune to label/title text changes.

Added missing id attributes to three buttons that were previously found only by text search: Export button (mb-export-btn), Statistics button (mb-stats-btn), Density button (mb-density-btn). Save to Disk (mb-save-to-disk-btn), Load from Disk (mb-load-from-disk-btn), and the Global Filter input (mb-global-filter-input) already had IDs; their call sites were updated to use getElementById.

Updated call sites: Export existingBtn guard, Export Ctrl+E shortcut, openExportMenu(); Statistics existingBtn guard, Statistics Ctrl+I shortcut (collapsed previous two-step fallback selector into one getElementById call); Density existingBtn guard, Density Ctrl+D shortcut, openDensityMenu(); clearAllFilters() global-filter input clear; Ctrl+G focus-global-filter shortcut; showStatsPanel() filter-status read; saveFilterHighlightState() global-filter read; Ctrl+S save shortcut; Ctrl+L load shortcut; ctrlMFunctionMap 'l' entry.
Escape-key event guard for the global filter changed from e.target.matches('[placeholder*=...]') to e.target.id === 'mb-global-filter-input' for consistency with the new ID-first pattern.

sections.label: üîß Code Quality
items: Removed dead-code variable `progressContainer` (assigned null, explicitly noted as removed from controls bar, never referenced).
Removed unused variable `baseUrl` in `startFetchingProcess`: the value was never read ‚Äî the fetch loop builds URLs via `new URL(window.location.href)` directly.

Removed three dead column-index placeholders `countryDateIdx`, `locationIdx`, and `areaIdx` (declared as -1 and never assigned or read after initialisation; their own comments stated "not used for splitting / idem"). Also removed the only remaining reference to them: a commented-out debug call that referenced `countryDateIdx`.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Settings ‚Äî 'Global Prefilter Highlight Color' picker opened at black: the schema default was the CSS named color "green". iro.js v5 does not accept CSS named color names as its color initialisation option and silently falls back to #000000, causing the picker wheel to open positioned at black. Fixed by changing the default to "#008000" (the hex equivalent of CSS green) so iro.js always receives a valid hex string. The library (VZ_MBLibrary 3.13.1) also adds a cssColorToHex() normalisation helper as a defensive backstop for any future named-color values.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Load from Disk (re-load on already-rendered page) ‚Äî sort state not reset: after loading, previously active column sorts (including multi-column sorts with coloured cell tints and highlighted sort-icon buttons) remained visible in the DOM. Fixed by adding a full sort reset in loadTableDataFromDisk() after makeH2sCollapsible(), mirroring the existing filter reset introduced in 9.97.7: (a) clearTints() is called for every entry in multiSortTintRegistry to remove multi-sort cell background colours, (b) .sort-icon-active is stripped from all sort-icon buttons, (c) all per-h3 .mb-sort-status spans are cleared, (d) multiTableSortStates and multiSortTintRegistry are both cleared so stale keys from the previous render do not accumulate.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: Load from Disk (re-load on already-rendered page) ‚Äî filter state not reset: after loading, the global filterInput still held the previous filter value but runFilter() was never called, so newly loaded rows were not affected by the stale filter. 'Toggle highlighting' and 'Clear ALL filters' buttons also showed incorrect visibility. Fixed by clearing filterInput.value, filterStatusDisplay, sortStatusDisplay and calling runFilter() + updateFilterButtonsVisibility() immediately after makeH2sCollapsible().

Load from Disk (re-load on already-rendered page) ‚Äî h2 click handler broken: makeH2sCollapsible() skipped all h2 elements on the second invocation because they still carried the 'mb-h2-processed' marker from the first render. The h2 DOM nodes are reused across re-renders (only h3s/tables are replaced), so their contentNodes closure and click handler became stale after the first disk load. Fixed by stripping 'mb-h2-processed', 'mb-toggle-h2', the injected toggle icon, and the stored click-handler reference (h2._mbClickHandler / h2._mbToggle) at the top of makeH2sCollapsible() before the registration loop, and by storing each new handler on h2._mbClickHandler so it can be cleanly removed on the next invocation.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: H2 click handler: clicking the plain text label of '.mb-master-toggle' (the 'all Types' text node) now triggers collapse/uncollapse of the current h2 section on plain click, or ALL h2 peers on Ctrl+click ‚Äî identical to clicking anywhere else on the h2 header. Implemented by detecting 'e.target.classList.contains("mb-master-toggle")' (text-node clicks bubble to the container element, not a child span) and wrapping the '.mb-master-toggle' guard with '!isMasterToggleLabelClick'. The interactive Show/Hide child spans are unaffected ‚Äî they already call stopPropagation() and never reach this handler.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes / Behaviour Change
items: H2 click handler: '#mb-sort-status-display' now behaves identically to '#mb-filter-status-display' ‚Äî plain click toggles only the current h2 section; Ctrl+click toggles ALL h2 peers. Both spans are again handled by the single 'isStatusClick' variable (the split into 'isFilterStatusClick'/'isSortStatusClick' introduced in 9.97.4 is reverted as it is no longer needed).

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes / Behaviour Change
items: H2 click handler: corrected toggle semantics for '#mb-filter-status-display' ‚Äî plain click now toggles only the current h2 section (normal header behaviour); Ctrl+click toggles ALL h2 peers. Previously a plain click on that span incorrectly triggered the all-toggle path. The '#mb-sort-status-display' all-toggle-on-any-click behaviour introduced in 9.97.3 is unchanged. Internally 'isStatusClick' is now split into 'isFilterStatusClick' and 'isSortStatusClick' to allow distinct branching per span.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements
items: H2 click handler: clicking '#mb-sort-status-display' (sort status span) now also triggers collapse/uncollapse of ALL h2 sections, identical to the existing '#mb-filter-status-display' behaviour. Both spans are now detected together as 'isStatusClick' before the guard clause and jointly exempted from the 'filterContainer.contains()' block. The variable formerly named 'isFilterStatusClick' has been renamed to 'isStatusClick' to reflect the broader scope.

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: H2 click handler: clicking '#mb-filter-status-display' now correctly triggers collapse/uncollapse of ALL h2 sections ‚Äî previously the guard clause blocked the click because '#mb-filter-status-display' is a child of 'filterContainer', causing 'filterContainer.contains(e.target)' to return early before 'isFilterStatusClick' was ever evaluated. Fix mirrors the h3 pattern: 'isFilterStatusClick' is now detected before the guard clause, and the 'filterContainer.contains()' check is wrapped with '!isFilterStatusClick' to explicitly exempt the read-only status span.

sections.label: ‚ú® Enhancements

H2 headers: clicking the '#mb-filter-status-display' global filter-status span now triggers collapse/uncollapse of ALL h2 sections (same behaviour as Ctrl+Click on the h2 header)

sections.label: üêõ Bug Fixes
items: H3 row-count badge now shows '(globally_filtered of total)' when only the global filter is active (was showing '(globally_filtered)' without the total)
H3 row-count badge when subtable filter is also active now shows '(locally_filtered of globally_filtered)/total' (was '(locally_filtered of globally_filtered)' without the absolute total)
H2 row-count badge mirrors the same 3-tier format as the sum over all subtables when any subtable filter is active
üî¥ Clear ALL filters button now also clears all sub-table specific filter input fields (title updated to 'Clear global/sub-table filters and ALL column filters in all sub-tables')
üé® Toggle highlighting button now also removes/restores sub-table filter highlights in addition to global and column-filter highlights (title updated accordingly)
Sub-table clear button text changed from 'Clear ALL filters' to 'Clear all COLUMN filters' and title updated to 'Clear all COLUMN filters for this table'

items.text: Sub-table filter: fixed highlight disappearing on second character and rows not restoring when deleting characters
sub: Root cause: applySubFilter() skipped rows with display:none, but those included rows previously hidden by the subtable filter itself ‚Äî so editing/deleting filter text never re-evaluated them

Fix: applySubFilter() now always restores all stf-hidden rows (data-mb-stf-hidden marker) and clears highlights at the top of every run, then re-evaluates ALL currently-visible rows against the new filter string

Secondary fix: highlight injection now uses a DocumentFragment instead of a wrapper span to inline the highlight spans directly into the parent element, preventing accumulation of empty wrapper spans across re-runs that confused the TreeWalker on subsequent calls
Deleting characters from the filter field now correctly restores matching rows (same behaviour as Escape / clear-button)

items.text: Per-subtable filter UI (üîç toggle on every h3 header in multi-table mode)
sub: A üîç icon is injected after the mb-row-count-stat span in each h3 header; clicking it toggles a subtable-specific filter bar on/off

Filter bar contains: text input with subtable-specific placeholder/tooltip, clear (‚úï) button, Cc (case-sensitive), Rx (regexp), Ex (exclude) checkboxes, and üé® Toggle highlighting button ‚Äî mirroring the global filter structure
All element IDs are unique per subtable (derived from the sanitized category name, e.g. mb-stf-Album-input)

Filtering is additive: only currently visible rows (not already hidden by global/column filter) are filtered; rows hidden by the subtable filter carry a data-mb-stf-hidden attribute so global re-renders can identify them
Matches are highlighted with .mb-subtable-filter-highlight (green background) independently from global and column filter highlights
üé® Toggle highlighting button toggles subtable-specific highlight on/off per subtable, independently of the global highlight toggle
First Escape press in the subtable filter input clears the text (and restores hidden rows); second press blurs the input
reapplyAllSubTableFilters() is called at the end of runFilter() so subtable filters remain active after global/column filter re-renders
h3 and h2 click handlers updated to guard against accidental collapse when clicking the toggle icon or filter container
